page.title: 15IVY COTTAGE BIGGIN HILL.
page.content: IVY COTTAGE In 1920 Mr. William Paine helped his firm build two bungalows. He liked Biggin Hill very much and wanted to live there. In 1922 when he was out of work he decided to take another look at Biggin Hill to find work and he succeeded. 1927, William Paine says that his house is "semi-detached and old". The main part has four rooms 2 up and 2 down. The walls were four inches thick. There were probably 2 bedrooms upstairs and a kitchen and a lounge downstairs. It had an outside toilet. The cottages were 80 years old in 1927. "Ive Cot" was built in 1847. When he bought the cottage they were known as No.1 and No.2 Ivy Cottages. His cottage was No.2,it was called "Ivy Cottage" but he called it "Ive Cot" for short.
